intro: Mascagnia pittieri, commonly known as the Florida starling or Florida star-grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces small, berry-like fruits that are green when immature and turn red when mature. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal in certain landscapes.
